ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: I need to reassure myself that something I did was actually completed.
I am uncertain of my own recollections of what happened during an event.
I trust my own intuition. (Reverse Scored)
When faced with a dilemma, it is difficult to know my own opinion.
I question whether I am sure of my facts.
I feel that I might have missed something because I didn't look carefully enough.
When I do mental arithmetic, I doubt my answer.
When I count items in a list, I feel like I might have missed one.
I don't trust my memory of simple, everyday things.
Even when I'm pretty sure about a memory, I start to doubt whether it's really correct.
I doubt my ability to remember accurately.
I look at things a second time to be sure that I got an accurate look.
It's easy for me to start doubting myself.
It is difficult for me to skim through reading material because I doubt whether I really got the general idea.
I have to read each individual word in a sentence.
I second-guess my decisions.
Even when I do something very carefully, I often feel that it is not done quite right.
I usually have doubt about the simple everyday things I do.
Total Score of Doubt Questionnaire
Notes: Sum of ratings for items doubt01 through doubt18
